Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

For any semi-normed addition-commutative group `E` and real number `δ`, the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `δ` from `x` is equal to the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `δ` from `0` translated by `x`.

type: ∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (δ : ℝ) (x : E), x +ᵥ Metric.closedBall 0 δ = Metric.closedBall x δ
name: vadd_closedBall_zero
docString: For any semi-normed addition-commutative group `E` and real number `δ`, the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `δ` from `x` is equal to the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `δ` from `0` translated by `x`.

The theorem `Int.gcd_dvd_left` states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `a` and `b` divides `a`. This is written in the Lean theorem prover as `↑(Int.gcd a b) ∣ a`, where `Int.gcd a b` computes the gcd of `a` and `b`, the `↑` operator converts that gcd from a natural number to an integer, and `∣` represents the "divides" relation. In mathematical terms, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

type: ∀ {a b : ℤ}, ↑(a.gcd b) ∣ a
name: Int.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The theorem `Int.gcd_dvd_left` states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `a` and `b` divides `a`. This is written in the Lean theorem prover as `↑(Int.gcd a b) ∣ a`, where `Int.gcd a b` computes the gcd of `a` and `b`, the `↑` operator converts that gcd from a natural number to an integer, and `∣` represents the "divides" relation. In mathematical terms, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

The discriminant `Δ'` of an elliptic curve over `R`, which is given as a unit in `R`.

type: {R : Type u} → [inst : CommRing R] → EllipticCurve R → Rˣ
name: EllipticCurve.Δ'
docString: The discriminant `Δ'` of an elliptic curve over `R`, which is given as a unit in `R`.

For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number δ, the set {x : E | ∥x∥ ≤ δ ∨ x ∈ s} equals the set {x : E | ∥x - o ∥ ≤ δ}, where o is the origin of E.

type: ∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (δ : ℝ) (s : Set E), Metric.ball 0 δ + s = Metric.thickening δ s
name: ball_add_zero
docString: For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number δ, the set {x : E | ∥x∥ ≤ δ ∨ x ∈ s} equals the set {x : E | ∥x - o ∥ ≤ δ}, where o is the origin of E.

This theorem states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of `a` and `b` (calculated as a nonnegative integer) is a divisor of `b`. In other words, `b` is a multiple of the GCD of `a` and `b`. Here, `∣` is the "divides" relation in integer arithmetic, so `↑(Int.gcd a b) ∣ b` means that `b` divided by the GCD of `a` and `b` yields an integer.

type: ∀ {a b : ℤ}, ↑(a.gcd b) ∣ b
name: Int.gcd_dvd_right
docString: This theorem states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of `a` and `b` (calculated as a nonnegative integer) is a divisor of `b`. In other words, `b` is a multiple of the GCD of `a` and `b`. Here, `∣` is the "divides" relation in integer arithmetic, so `↑(Int.gcd a b) ∣ b` means that `b` divided by the GCD of `a` and `b` yields an integer.

Greatest common divisor of a multiset

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Multiset α → α
name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

If `ξ` is an integer, all its convergents equal `ξ`.

type: ∀ {ξ : ℤ} (n : ℕ), Real.convergent (↑ξ) n = ↑ξ
name: Real.convergent_of_int
docString: If `ξ` is an integer, all its convergents equal `ξ`.

The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β)
  (E : Set α),
  Filter.Tendsto (fun δ => Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f) (nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0))
    (nhds (Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f))
name: tendsto_mulIndicator_thickening_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

type: ∀ {n d : ℕ}, d ∣ n → Nat.totient (n / d) = (Finset.filter (fun k => Nat.gcd n k = d) (Finset.range n)).card
name: Nat.totient_div_of_dvd
docString: For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

If a solution has `x > 1`, then `d` is positive.

type: ∀ {d : ℤ} {a : Pell.Solution₁ d}, 1 < Pell.Solution₁.x a → 0 < d
name: Pell.Solution₁.d_pos_of_one_lt_x
docString: If a solution has `x > 1`, then `d` is positive.

The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

name: PNat.gcd
docString:
The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] (f : α → β) (E : Set α) (x : α),
  ∀ᶠ (δ : ℝ) in nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0),
    Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f x = Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f x
name: mulIndicator_thickening_eventually_eq_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set eventually coincide
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as δ>0 tends to zero.

The Kronecker delta as a locally constant map from `π C (· ∈ s)` to `ℤ`.

type:
{I : Type u} →
  [inst : LinearOrder I] →
    (C : Set (I → Bool)) →
      (s : Finset I) →
        ↑(Profinite.NobelingProof.π C fun x => x ∈ s) → LocallyConstant ↑(Profinite.NobelingProof.π C fun x => x ∈ s) ℤ
name: Profinite.NobelingProof.spanFinBasis
docString: The Kronecker delta as a locally constant map from `π C (· ∈ s)` to `ℤ`.

The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), Nat.divisors (m * n) = Nat.divisors m * Nat.divisors n
name: Nat.divisors_mul
docString:
The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

If `ξ` is rational, then the good rational approximations to `ξ` have bounded
numerator and denominator.

type: ∀ {ξ q : ℚ}, |ξ - q| < 1 / ↑q.den ^ 2 → q.den ≤ ξ.den ∧ ⌈ξ * ↑q.den⌉ - 1 ≤ q.num ∧ q.num ≤ ⌊ξ * ↑q.den⌋ + 1
name: Rat.den_le_and_le_num_le_of_sub_lt_one_div_den_sq
docString:
If `ξ` is rational, then the good rational approximations to `ξ` have bounded
numerator and denominator.

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [self : GCDMonoid α] → α → α → α
name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

The multiplicative indicators of closed δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the
multiplicative indicator of the set, as δ tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β)
  (E : Set α),
  Filter.Tendsto (fun δ => Set.mulIndicator (Metric.cthickening δ E) f) (nhds 0) (nhds (Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f))
name: tendsto_mulIndicator_cthickening_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
The multiplicative indicators of closed δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the
multiplicative indicator of the set, as δ tends to zero.

The integers modulo `n : ℕ`.

type: ℕ → Type
name: ZMod
docString: The integers modulo `n : ℕ`.

The modulus of (uniform) continuity for `f`, chosen so `|f x - f y| < ε/2` when `|x - y| < δ`.

type: C(↑unitInterval, ℝ) → (ε : ℝ) → 0 < ε → ℝ
name: bernsteinApproximation.δ
docString: The modulus of (uniform) continuity for `f`, chosen so `|f x - f y| < ε/2` when `|x - y| < δ`.

If `s` is finite, the product of the elements of the list `factors C s x`
is the delta function at `x`.

type:
∀ {I : Type u} [inst : LinearOrder I] (C : Set (I → Bool)) (s : Finset I)
  (x : ↑(Profinite.NobelingProof.π C fun x => x ∈ s)),
  List.prod (Profinite.NobelingProof.factors C s x) = Profinite.NobelingProof.spanFinBasis C s x
name: Profinite.NobelingProof.factors_prod_eq_basis
docString:
If `s` is finite, the product of the elements of the list `factors C s x`
is the delta function at `x`.

`A[x]` is a fractional ideal for every integral `x`.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] (S : Submonoid R) {P : Type u_2} [inst_1 : CommRing P] [inst_2 : Algebra R P]
  [loc : IsLocalization S P] (x : P), IsIntegral R x → IsFractional S (Subalgebra.toSubmodule (Algebra.adjoin R {x}))
name: FractionalIdeal.isFractional_adjoin_integral
docString: `A[x]` is a fractional ideal for every integral `x`.

If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `δ`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‖f' x - A‖ ≤ δ`.

type:
∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : FiniteDimensional ℝ E] {s : Set E}
  {f : E → E} [inst_3 : MeasurableSpace E] [inst_4 : BorelSpace E] (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure E)
  [inst_5 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure μ] {A : E →L[ℝ] E} {δ : NNReal},
  ApproximatesLinearOn f A s δ →
    MeasurableSet s →
      ∀ (f' : E → E →L[ℝ] E),
        (∀ x ∈ s, HasFDerivWithinAt f (f' x) s x) → ∀ᵐ (x : E) ∂MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict μ s, ‖f' x - A‖₊ ≤ δ
name: ApproximatesLinearOn.norm_fderiv_sub_le
docString:
If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `δ`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‖f' x - A‖ ≤ δ`.

The zeroth convergent of `ξ` is `⌊ξ⌋`.

type: ∀ (ξ : ℝ), Real.convergent ξ 0 = ↑⌊ξ⌋
name: Real.convergent_zero
docString: The zeroth convergent of `ξ` is `⌊ξ⌋`.
